marno.server

Class SocketSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • marno.server.Session
      • marno.server.SocketSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    class SocketSession
extends Session
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Represents a connected socket client.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.net.Socket client
      The client socket associated with this session.
      private boolean isActive
      The current status of the session.
      private SocketServer server
      The socket server hosting this session.
      private java.lang.String sessionId
      The unique ID of the session.
      private java.io.BufferedReader socketIn
      The client socket input reader.
      private java.io.PrintStream socketOut
      The client socket output writer.

      SocketSession(SocketServer clientServer, java.net.Socket clientSocket)
      Constructs a new session tied to a socket connection and a server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SocketSession

        public SocketSession(SocketServer clientServer,
                     java.net.Socket clientSocket)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a new session tied to a socket connection and a server.
        Parameters:
        clientServer - the server hosting the session
        clientSocket - the client socket from the incoming connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the client socket could not be read

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Checks if this session is still active. A socket session is considered inactive if its client has not sent any messages in the past few seconds.
        Specified by:
        isActive in class Session
        Returns:
        true if still active, false otherwise

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs while the socket can still be read from or until the client quits.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • sendHistory

        public void sendHistory(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> messages)
        Sends a history of all past messages to the client. Format: HISTORY <num> <len1> <msg1> <len2> <msg2> ...
        Specified by:
        sendHistory in class Session
        Parameters:
        messages - the list of messages to send

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String date,
                        java.lang.String message)
        Sends a public message to the client. Format: MSG <date> <message>
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in class Session
        Parameters:
        date - the date on which the message was received
        message - the contents of the message

      • sendPrivateMessage

        public void sendPrivateMessage(java.lang.String date,
                               java.lang.String username,
                               java.lang.String message)
        Sends a private message to the client from another user. Format: PRIVATE <date> <username> <message>
        Specified by:
        sendPrivateMessage in class Session
        Parameters:
        date - the date on which the message was received
        username - the source of the message
        message - the contents of the message

      • sendUserList

        public void sendUserList(java.lang.String[] users)
        Sends a list of all users currently logged in to the server. Format: USERS <user1> <user2> <user3> ...
        Specified by:
        sendUserList in class Session
        Parameters:
        users - the list of users currently on the server

      • handleInput

        private void handleInput(java.lang.String input)
        Handles a line of input from the client. Socket clients and servers communicate using text-based, newline-terminated commands. Arguments are space-separated; the first element indicates which command it is.
        Parameters:
        input - a command to process from the client

      • sendError

        private void sendError(int errorCode,
                       java.lang.String... arguments)
        Sends an error code to the client, with optional arguments. Format: ERROR <code> <arguments>...
        Parameters:
        errorCode - the error's code number
        arguments - optional arguments, for certain errors

      • disconnect

        private void disconnect()
                 throws ServerException
        Disconnects the current client from the server and stops listening. Format: DISCONNECT
        Throws:
        ServerException - if the client couldn't be disconnected cleanly
